p: CMV infection is an independent predictor of mortality after solid organ transplantation. The use of anti-CMV drugs, either through antiviral prophylaxis or preemptive therapy, led to reduction in the overall mortality after solid organ transplantation. An analysis of 437 liver transplant recipients demonstrated that CMV disease occurred in 8.5 % of the patients and that its occurrence was independently associated with a fivefold increased risk of all-cause mortality and an 11-fold increased risk of infection-related mortality [ 65].
